The leges formed enactments of one of the assemblies of the whole Roman people. These are the collection of the many Lex (laws) that were derived and expanded over the years.

Jus gentium was applied in unwritten form for the most part to both Romans as well as foreigners. The jus civile is more well known, but only applied to citizens.

These finally merged in the 3rd century CE and the written manuscripts are what most argue are the sole basis of law
It followed the passage of the Lex Hortensia (287 B.C.E.) when the plebiscita become binding on all classes of citizens that the nature of Lex plebiscita started to be universally determined
The legal doctrine of Specificatio and Ususfructus did cover aspects of intellectual property and even determined rights of guilds and specialised professions
